text: Hey Steven! I am having some troubles with maya’s physical sky... is that something you could help with? :innocent:
Hey! Is that using arnold? I haven't used that in some time but should be able to! What's the issue? :]
Using arnold, yes! Uhm it has to do with the direction of it
I rotate it and it works normally but when it hits the angle i need the shadow disappears
hm sounds strange, is that when you rotate it in elevation is disappears?
<https://docs.arnoldrenderer.com/display/A5AFMUG/Physical+Sky> if you haven't seen already!
I rotate the actual physical sky and the angle changes normally as i need it to
hm is that with the viewport manipulators to rotate? maybe try using the elevation/azimuth controls in the properties?
we dont have arnold installed here so i cant test anything ¬_¬
Doing that as well with a similar result, getting almost there with the angle :sweat_smile: lighting is tougher than it looks
hah yeah its a fine and patient thing is lighting
How have you been? Still sad about the 11.5hr render going wrong... and my maya going wrong and losing me work...
those last two attachments are broken it seems
Maya is my nemesis

hah yes i remember my post uni days of long renders and lost work, happens to the best of us! take the loss as a chance to get out a better version - take the time to test for render time as well, and cheat whatever you can in post!
but sounds like you're doing that already :slightly_smiling_face:
I will leave the shadow a bit inaccurate.. or might add a spotlight and turn off the light aspect and keep the shadow information and just parent that to the car....

hm im not sure if it would be faster in arnold but you might try the non physical sky for this shot - a 3 point lighting system with a directional light, rim (area) and either a directional fill to fake the bounce, or another area
thats the setup we use in redshift
but redshift is a GPU renderer so we get pretty speedy results out of it
Lacking in that area...
2gb nvidia  gt 750m... 6-7years old :joy:
Been looking at some treats for me (new amd 16core and 24core processors ) but the builds go up to 3k :sweat_smile: with A very nice and strong nvidia card

oof yeah thats old xD yeah it mounts up pretty fast, i think i spent about 1k on mine once i'd been freelancing/permalancing for a year or so, but before that was running on ~£600 builds, but that was a good 7 years or so ago!
I'd definitely have a try with a simple light setup rather than the physical one, you'll have more control and might save some computing too
I am supposed to animate the car though and the lights
Wouldn’t that affect render time?
per frame yes, whats animating of the light?
I need to animate the car
Will directionals be okay?
I will give it a try
Didn’t see the word “directional” in your previous message my bad
you could probably do it with all three being directional yeah if its a large distance its moving!
you might even find that an area light parented to the car to maintain the same distance might be cheaper to render, but i couldnt say for sure with arnold!
are you using any GI?
And one for the physical sky so i can add an extra layer of lights
I sampled the sky from the actual footage for the physical sky
I was planning on staying away from 3D because we were not taught very well in uni but due to this project and some Of Hugo Guerra’s videos i got inspired to try
<https://docs.arnoldrenderer.com/display/A5AFMUG/Using+the+Sky+Dome+Light>
was just about to say could do that :smile:
yeah its definitely good to learn
maya can be frustrating but its a great one to get the hang of
It’s a pain especially on a mac...
mm i bet!
A lot more bugs and crashes on a mac
Just looking forward to my first job so i can invest in a little beastie of a pc :innocent: just raw computing power
I've never had the pleasure :sweat_smile: the only macs I've used were for the web design / adobe modules at college
I love mine but it will never have the correct money/performance ratio...
yeah indeed
I would rather dump 3k on a beast or a pc than £3600 for the strongest macbook
Of*
yeah you get much more for your money and its a lot easier to upgrade pieces if you time it right
I just need to survive through this project... 3D fascinates me but scares me... a whole different dimension of things that can go wrong...
I am scared to spend too little on my machine in case it’s not worth it so would rather go all the way instead and keep it for years to come
are you planning to build your own?
Yup
I don’t know much except the basics but i have a friend who knows EVERYTHING :sweat_smile:
nice. my housemate recently got himself a gaming rig that i helped him build - it's a lot of fun :smile: ah nice!
Newest AMD was released a few days ago... it’s a BEAST....
16cores 32 threads and 24cores 48 threads and an overkill of 32cores and 64threads :joy:
they were showcasing an AMD at the dota event i went to in the summer! have always had intel xD hah
oof
Always had intel to but everyone switched to AMD after this release
Too*
But also means blowing half of my savings...

its definitely a big step. I'd advise a little caution. I ended up buying a machine that i never really used for rendering, couple months later i got the job at blue zoo and haven't had the time/need for personal projects at home! I dont regret getting it as I still use it for other things & didn't put myself out too much in getting it! But you never know whats around the bend :slightly_smiling_face:
I see i see!! I realised something... i have set the whole lighting setup and AOVs (correctly this time)
Realised i need to animate the car :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
AND RIG :sweat_smile:
hah yes that'll help :smile: what are you rigging?
My matchmove has a small slide in the last few frames (30-ish frames about 3cm slide)
Don’t know how to fix it but my solve error is 0.5 xD
My indirect diffuse is noisy

nice! Arnold has quite good control for noise if i remember right, the sampling is quite split apart? Looking good man, is it the drifting in to the middle of the street that you mean by the  slide, or is that how it is in the original footage?
The track is drifting in the Z axis
I will make the car drift to counteract that :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
ah yeah, probably the fastest fix
I will keep the animation basic (didn’t rig after all, it’s a straight road)
nice that looks great
Thanks! Need to render and comp...
Sad... will render overnight instead of wasting my day on that
I will try to comp one frame and then replace the read file with the whole sequence, I believe that would work
yeah would definitely send a single frame / 5 frames and get it working, check for noise etc. before you send the lot
its how we work here too

we send the sequence to the farm at say, 50 priority, with still frames of each shot at a higher priority, something like 70, so that we get that frame back to check asap, and then have time to make any changes
I see! My shadows and indirect diffuse are a bit :hankey: but nothing a blur won’t fix
hah yes if in doubt blur the :poop: out of it :smile:
I even included an emission pass for the back lights of the car in case i feel like adding a small glow
nice
do you have a cryptomatte pass?
/ access to cryptomattes in nuke
Don’t know what it does
oh its a game changer
In nuke, no
hm
I have it in maya
As an AOV
ah yeah its a plugin for nuke i think
not sure you can use them in your version right?
you get an ID for every single mesh in your scene that you can pick from a single AOV
rather than the usualy RGB ID passes
usual*
Oh i see! My shadowmatte ia included in some of my passes and it annoys me
It’s in my depth pass, ID pass, motionvector....
hm thats odd, are you merging your aovs into a single .exr?
Yeah
i havent used arnold since it was a standalone plugin so im not sure really :confused: but could be worth splitting them? is a long shot
Took 25minutes to render one frame :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing: back to adjusting my sampling
It was the motion blur adding all this noise, considering rendering out motion vectors and comping it in
